required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fetoscopic Open Spina Bifida Repair Using the SAFER Technique
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Prenatal Correction of Spina Bifida Using Fetoscopy and the SAFER Technique on Long-term Neurodevelopment.

brief_summary.textblock: Children submitted to fetoscopic in utero myelomeningocele repair using the SAFER (Skin-over-biocellulose for Anternatal FEtoscopic Repair) technique will evaluate at 30 months or more, regarding ambulation, neurodevelopment, urinary and fecal status.

detailed_description.textblock: Children submitted to fetoscopic in utero myelomeningocele repair using the SAFER (Skin-over-biocellulose for Anternatal FEtoscopic Repair) technique will evaluate the neuropsicomotor development at 30 months of chronological age. The mental evaluation will use the Bayley III and thePEDI neurodevelopmental scale. The motor development will use the difference between anatomic and motor level of the lesion. Urinary and fecal continence will be evaluated using clinical and ultrasonographic parameters. For the anatomical level determination, immaging of the spine at the lesion level will be used. Motor level and ambulation will be evaluated through standard clinical examination.

primary_outcome.description: Need to treat hydrocephaly in the first year of life

primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 months of cronological age or more
30 months of cronogical age or more

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 months of cronological age or more
secondary_outcome.description: To compare anatomical level with motor level

arm_group.description: Children submitted to fetoscopic in utero myelomeningocele repair using the SAFER (Skin-over-biocellulose for Anternatal FEtoscopic Repair) technique will evaluate the neuropsicomotor development at 30 months of chronological age or older

intervention.description: Children will be evaluated trough Bayley III and PEDI scale. They also will be examined by pediatrician, neurosurgeon, orthopedics and phisiatry

study_pop.textblock: Children submitted to prenatal repair of open spina bifida using the fetoscopic percutaneous repair technique - SAFER

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Children operated in utero using the SAFER technique
Exclusion Criteria:
Death before 30 month
